alert.note: Alert for Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Natrona and south central Johnson Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 244 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Midwest, or 20 miles southeast of Kaycee, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, along with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Midwest and Edgerton around 300 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Teapot Rock. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 213 and 237. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.

area.areaDesc: Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County
